data.title: Flag, Federal & Regional, Free Territory of Trieste

data.text:
This media is not currently available online. Contact the Image and Film Licensing team about access

Description

Object description

Flag of the Free Territory of Triest, mid-20th Century.

Label

The last flag to fly over Zone A of the Free Territory of Trieste, before it returned to Italian control in 1954. Trieste and the surrounding region became a political football in the nascent cold war after its joint occupation by New Zealand and Yugoslav forces in 1945. A free territory was established to defuse any potential clash with Yugoslavia, but the establishment of a civil administration was blocked by the USSR. Therefore Zone A (which included the city) stayed under Anglo-American military control, while Zone B, to the South, was governed by Yugoslavia. The latter's split with the USSR eventually led to a peaceful resolution in which Zone A became Italian and Zone B Yugoslavian. This was not finally ratified until 1975 however.

History note

This flag was the last one flown in the city of Trieste, within Zone A of the Free Territory of Trieste, before the area was handed to the Italian State in 1954.

Our collections information

We have over a million object records online, and we are adding to this all the time. Our records are never finished. Sometimes we discover new information that changes what we know about an object, such as who made it or used it. Sometimes we change how an object is interpreted. We sometimes make mistakes in our spelling, transcription or categorisation, or miss information out of our records.

Read more about our collections and the information we hold. Developing our collections information

Our collections information

Please use this form to give us feedback on an object. The form will be sent to our Collections Management Team who will use it to improve our object records. We receive a lot of comments and can't respond to each one, but we do read them all and will respond where we can.

IWM A 13308

Second World War

How Britain Celebrated Christmas During The Second World War

Six years of war brought many changes to familiar festive rituals. Christmas celebrations during the Second World War often had to be scaled down or adjusted as restrictions and shortages took their toll.
